FullDescriptions:
Open Until Filled
Alcohol Beverage Services (ABS) seeks a highly skilled Systems Integrator, Project Manager, Microsoft SQL Database Administrator, and Developer to support the Departmental IT Systems to fill the role of Senior IT Specialist. This position will p rovide expert level professional information systems technology work for the Alcohol Beverage Services, a wholesale and retail business within government. At a high level, this includes identifying strategies for providing effective IT solutions, identifying, designing and providing for staff training needs, making key decisions regarding strategies for efficient, effective IT solutions, directing the acquisition, installation, testing, maintenance and troubleshooting of programs.
The employee will:
React positively, quickly and nimbly to issues and problems that can arise in the day to day. Independently research better solutions to improve performance and efficiencies within the department while maintaining current timelines for other projects.
There are ongoing needs that will require a project orientated approach to improvements in the department. They will require consultation, gap analysis and planning. This could also require assistance from other departments or outside vendors.
Support Oracle EBS and Oracle Business Intelligence systems
Support the retail POS (point-of-sale) system (currently supporting 25 stores with growth planned in the future to 30+ stores)
Support Warehouse IT systems
Assist with the customization, implementation, and integration of a replacement case management solution to track inspections results of beverage alcohol license-holders and board dispositions
Support the ABS web development and maintenance of websites.
The management of security systems at the retail store level and the warehouse
Enhance and maintain a disaster recovery plan for business mission critical systems
Manage enhancement and support of the current POS software customization and developing future customization based on business or regulatory needs
This position requires close collaboration with outside consultants/technical staff, County project managers/technical staff, and various functional business stakeholders within the department. Other duties include managing small to medium sized software development, and implementation projects, providing Microsoft SQL database administration and development. The employee is expected to be, or quickly become, a Subject Matter Expert on the business processes for the Administrative, Warehouse, Retail, and Licensure Regulation Education Divisions. Preferred Skills will include, advanced project management skills; superior communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of an organization.
This position will require sharing on call duties with other team members during the evenings, weekends, and holidays and will work with all levels of staff in a union environment.
Additional Employment Information
OHR reviews the minimum qualifications of all applicants, irrespective of whether the candidate has previously been found to have met the minimum requirements for the job or been temporarily promoted to the same position. This evaluation is based solely on the information contained in the application/resume submitted for this specific position/IRC.

Title: Data & Database Administrator
Responsibilities: Design, test, maintain, and carry out procedures for upgrades, migrations, backups, restores, and disaster recovery for high availability mission critical databases
Requirement: BS degree in computer science or another technical discipline
FullDescriptions:
World Learning seeks a talented Database Administrator (DBA) to join the IT department. The DBA will possess a strong working knowledge of database administration methodologies and techniques, and a good understanding of logical and physical database design principles to design, install, maintain, and upgrade the organization’s production and non-production databases.

This position will work with department heads and the technology team to provide strategic direction to Data Governance, Data Compliance, Data Architecture, and Data Integrations into World Learning applications.

A subset of this position works closely with analysts, developers, and system administrators to understand requirements and identify solutions and is responsible for the administration of all SQL servers, the Student Information System, and reporting solutions. Occasional 24/7 on call availability is required for this position.

This position is based in EITHER Brattleboro, VT or Washington, D.C.


Responsibilities
 Design, test, maintain, and carry out procedures for upgrades, migrations, backups, restores, and disaster recovery for high availability mission critical databases
 Monitor and analyze database performance, allocate resources, and tune to achieve optimum database performance
 Design, code, edit, install and verify stored procedures and functions for accessing, maintaining, and populating databases
 Design, implement, and manage required security controls around data and databases
 Maintain audit trails to detect potential security violations, make recommendations to improve security, and participate in security investigations as needed
 Install, configure, deploy, and administer MS SQL Server instances in clustered and non-clustered environments
 Design and propose changes in database architecture, implementation, deployments, and administration of database infrastructure using automation tools
 Help develop common standards, methods, and procedures for all database administration
 Participate in long-term upgrade planning and capacity management
 Main ERP and related systems include: Ellucian Colleague, WebAdvisor, User Interface, eCommerce - both database and web components
 Perform all main SIS system installations, patches, and upgrades. Serve as the primary contact with system vendors
 Manage account setup, policy, security, access, and standards
 Ensure the main SIS-related software functions optimally, securely, and redundantly
 Develop, manage, and implement project plans using appropriate planning tools and software. Provide second level end user support for the main SIS and its related tools


Requirements
 BS degree in computer science or another technical discipline
 5+ years with MS SQL Server 2012 or later supporting highly available web-based applications
 Experience with data modeling, data model optimization, and translation into implementation
 Experience with high availability - WSFC, FCI, AG, and DR options and SSIS & SSRS tools for SQL Server
 Thorough understanding of web/database interfaces as well as Tomcat and/or IIS
 Work well in a team environment and exhibit flexibility with shifting work priorities
 Competent in project planning and self-management


Desired
 Experience with Ellucian Colleague system administration, including WebAdvisor
 Proven skills in documenting policies, procedures, troubleshooting techniques, etc.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite


Why World Learning

Eighty five years ago, a group of young Americans sailed to Germany on a cultural exchange program. They returned home with lifelong friendships, a broader understanding of the world, and the ability to empathize with people from other cultures. This was the beginning of The Experiment in International Living. It was also the beginning of World Learning.

The Experiment in International Living is still a vibrant part of World Learning today. But as global needs have grown, World Learning has grown too. Today World Learning operates the SIT graduate school, study abroad programs, and leads international development and civic activism programs throughout the world.

In 60 countries with an annual budget of over $100 million, World Learning empowers people and strengthens institutions that help people learn, grow, and thrive.

Today, more than ever, the world needs fully engaged global citizens who recognize what it means to build bridges of tolerance, respect, and understanding and have the knowledge, skills, and international experience to assume leadership positions in the world. At this moment of unprecedented, acute, international need and opportunity, World Learning is responding by re-investing in its programs, deepening their impact, and implementing a global vision for the future.

Title: Database Administrator
FullDescriptions:
ASRC Federal InuTeq is looking for a new member for our development team that supports the Energy Compensation System (ECS) for the Division of Energy Employees Occupational Illness Compensation (DEEOIC) at the US Department of Labor (DOL). The position is on site at the DOL facility at 3rd and Constitution in Washington DC and is conveniently located near the Judiciary Square Metro station. This is a full time DBA position.

The selected candidate will perform the following:
Has overall responsibility of the design and implementation of the back end server solution for DEEOIC.
Will provide database support during development and maintenance in all of the DEEOIC different environments (development, integration, testing, and production).
Will proactively generate relevant ideas for new and improved use of technology, and must understand the impacts of new projects and technical impacts to the supported system.
Should be able to assist in the development of a project plan to migrate the database to another platform, if necessary.
Will be proficient at database design and modeling, and work with the government IT data lead and support contractors to create a comprehensive database design documentation and schemes.
Must be able to work with other development teams to help design, implement new database changes or designs.
Will contribute, write, and maintain DB scripts for system DB maintenance.
Must have the ability to work as part of a team as well as independently towards assigned goals.
Demonstrate the ability to translate customer requirements into solutions.
Strong knowledge of SQL and dialect of SQL used for IBM DB2, T-SQL for Microsoft SQL server. Experience with an Agile Scrum development methodology is a plus.
Evaluate and recommend relational database structures, monitor and recommend tuning strategies for specific databases like SQL Server or My SQL database environments for improved system performance.
Provide guidance and assistance in the development, maintenance, administration and enforcement of database management standards and guidelines.
Participate in walkthrough with development staff and conduct DBA training and presentations.
Analyze database requirements
Review physical data models for design integrity and adherence to standards
Make recommendations for, and implement underlining storage and security structures
Review and approve application based scripts, utilities, stored procedures, functions and triggers.
Develop and execute appropriate Data Definition Language (DDL) to support the project
Provide query performance monitoring and tuning recommendations.
Provide input on database and environment parameter settings and tuning.
Provide general database expertise to application developers.
Responsible for database capacity planning for adequate database storage.
Insure change management and documentation for database changes
Will serve as the lead for the Data Engineering team and be responsible for the team's performance and reporting weekly status.
Must have knowledge of migration to Cloud services.

Qualifications:
Must have expert technical knowledge and 7 to 10 years demonstrated experience in database design and administration with specific experience using DB2, My SQL, SQL Server 2008 or higher and other relational databases.
Expertise with Physical database design issues
Must be able to operate in an Agile-based development and maintenance environment
Expertise with SQL tuning and SQL development including development of stored procedures.
Familiarity with SAP Business Objects Universe design methodology
Candidates must be detail oriented and have the ability to perform in high pressure situations
Knowledge of Case Management and Financial systems preferable
Must be a Team Player and have experience working closely with developers.
Must possess a well developed ability to communicate verbally and in written form with both technical and non technical audiences
U.S. Citizen or U.S. Permanent Resident
Candidate is required to possess or successfully complete a National Agency Check with Inquiries (NACI) and FBI Criminal History Check
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology

Overview
This project provides comprehensive automation/information technology support to Department of the Army Intelligence Information Services (DAIIS) worldwide intelligence dissemination, data management, and knowledge management missions
Responsibilities
In this role you provide database administration and management support for Relational Database Management Systems (RDMS) in a Microsoft SQL Server-based environment, hosting database across the 8 supported networks for SharePoint and various .NET applications.
Specific duties for this role include:
Maintain quality of service and availability of RDMSs by establishing and enforcing organizational-defined standards ensuring the performance, integrity and security of databases.
Ensure SQL servers and instances have the latest Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) STIGs applied.
Manipulate database objects and develop stored procedures, stored functions, and packages when needed.
Ensure healthy and reliable data replication is maintained using database mirroring and availability
Monitor performance and manage parameters to provide fast query responses to ‘front end’ users optimizing code and stored procedures while assisting application developers with database
Configure and utilize database connectivity tools and utilities while supporting developers, programmers, and engineers during software
Map out a conceptual design for database enhancements; considering both ‘back end’ organization of data and ‘front end’ accessibility for end
Research, test, and implement new versions of the Database Management System (DBMS) for inclusion into DAIIS infrastructure as they become
Implement security requirements for least privileged access to organizational databases and monitor user access and
Develop and maintain database documentation to include updating existing and creating new Standard Operating Procedures, TTPs, logical architecture diagrams, entity relationship diagrams, server lists, and other database administration related documentation on monthly basis adhering to organizational templates and
Produce entity relationship and data flow diagrams, and database normalization schemas that are logical to physical data maps and data table
Develop, manage, and test backup and recovery plans, ensuring that storage, archiving, backup, and recovery procedures are functioning correctly to include weekly integrity testing of no less than ten (10) percent of database backups on the supported
Conduct capacity planning and assist with storage and architecture
Qualifications
This position requires two certifications
DoD Directive 8570.01-M at an Information Assurance Technical (IAT) II level
Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MSCA) - SQL Server 2012/2014 or SQL Database Administration Certification
A TS/SCI clearance with SBI and ability to attain SI, TK, G, HCS, and NATO Secret clearance is required.

Experience required for this role
Eight years of experience in SQL database administration supporting and managing databases in a production environment
Five years of experience installing, configuring, and
supporting Microsoft SQL Server in High Availability
Group configurations
Five years of experience with T-SQL and ability to write scripts, stored procedures, triggers, and views to automate maintenance functions
Three years of experience serving as a team leader working as both part of a team and independently to assign/review immediate tasks, set priorities, maintain task progress, validate team members work consistent with the organizational goals and deadlines.
Five years of experience mentoring junior personnel on proper practices and
Four years of experience planning and implementing security measures to safeguard information against accidental or unauthorized damage, modification or disclosure in accordance with industry best practices and DISA

Title: SQL Database Administrator
Responsibilities:
Perform data modeling and optimization, preliminary data received from customer designs, data analysis, and creation of new records and information updates as needed.
Perform installation and maintenance of contract data into primary and third party applications provide technical support to and training to members of the team.
Perform feasibility studies, cost/benefit analysis, and user training in response to user requests. Perform team leader functions for projects involving multiple parties: manage deadlines; provide status reports; facilitate final testing and project sign-off.
Responsible for backup of all local databases and file directories applications, in coordination with the IT Manager.
Ensure all maintenance jobs are preformed.
FullDescriptions:
This position administers, manages, designs, documents, and evaluates a variety of database management systems; performs complex technical, analytical and professional services involving program/member services, evaluation, database-driven Web sites, office operations support, and problem resolution.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Perform data modeling and optimization, preliminary data received from customer designs, data analysis, and creation of new records and information updates as needed.
Perform installation and maintenance of contract data into primary and third party applications provide technical support to and training to members of the team.
Perform feasibility studies, cost/benefit analysis, and user training in response to user requests. Perform team leader functions for projects involving multiple parties: manage deadlines; provide status reports; facilitate final testing and project sign-off.
Responsible for backup of all local databases and file directories applications, in coordination with the IT Manager.
Ensure all maintenance jobs are preformed.

Additional Duties and Responsibilities
Experience using visual studio and crystal reports.
Perform and maintain daily backup, transaction log and full backups of data. Define, analyze, design, develop, test, and implement software applications with accuracy and timeliness.
Ensures development standards are followed. Ability to write reports in VB visual Studio and develop AD-HOC reports from a SQL environment.
Ensures application support documentation is provided and made available to the support team and user training is provided as necessary.
Ensure base level software applications are maintained as highest priority: assist in testing upgrades to existing applications; and assist the team in solving software failures.
Analyze user department needs and assist in eliminating redundancy and improve efficiency and effectiveness of operations.
Provide assistance to local and field sites.
Manage mail operations database applications
 Assist with patches and version upgrades Flexible work schedule including weekends
 Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor or designated individual. Participate in all other training required by funding sources and/or the Corporation such as Human Rights training.
Qualifications

Education, Experience, Certifications and Licensures

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience. Three years experience working with databases required.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
 Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices. Working technical experience with designing, building, installing, configuring and supporting database servers.
 Hands-on database tuning and troubleshooting experience. Experience with data processing flow charting techniques.
 Project management experience. Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.

Physical Demands

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk, hear and respond to customers and employees. The employee frequently is required to stand; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to walk and sit. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to outside weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

Title: Database Administrator
FullDescriptions:
cFocus Software seeks a Database Administrator in Silver Spring, MD for a 3 year contract (from 2019-2021) with NOAA.

Required Qualifications Include:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Associate-level cloud certification (i.e. Azure Fundamentals, Azure Administrator Associate, or Azure Security Engineer Associate)
10+ years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server
Ability to identify and troubleshoot issues with little oversight
Desired Qualifications Include:
NOAA Experience
Completed NOAA Background Investigation
Responsibilities Include:
Reviews, evaluates, designs, implements and maintains infrastructure and web hosting databases. Identifies data sources, constructs data decomposition diagrams, provides data flow diagrams and documents the process. Writes codes for database access, modifications, and constructions including stored procedures.
Develops and formulates standards, procedures, and conventions for database use.
Works with technical/programming staff to ensure database security.
Masters a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures.
Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of complicated tasks.
Successfully perform and document all duties consistent with optimal database management, operations, and administration.
Support cloud database implementations—both IaaS and PaaS.
Continuously monitor and improve DBMS security, performance, space utilization, and reliability.
Perform regular and preventative daily/weekly/monthly database maintenance.
Regularly tune and reorganize databases to ensure optimal performance and availability of data.
Minimize the risk of data loss with daily and as-needed database backup and recovery operations.
Manage database replication to assure optimal success based on infrastructure and customer needs.
Carefully manage and administer security rights assignments to DBMS platforms to ensure confidentiality and integrity of data.
Monitor systems to ensure compliance with organizational security policy and identifies malicious activity.
Prevent the unauthorized disclosure or revision of information and ensure integrity and availability with security plans and access controls that follows NIST and best practices.
Encrypt all data identified as personally identifiable information, sensitive information, business sensitive information, or Privacy Act information at rest.
Test and applied system and DBMS patches and updates as soon as they are issued.
Perform requirements analysis and database redesign based on user and organizational needs and objectives. Implement SQL Reporting Services and identify and develop needed reports, especially to support dashboard creation.
Provide best-practice Database Administration services using the latest version of Microsoft SQL Server operating in the environment.
Ensure continuous operation of the Hyper-V cluster services.
Support stand-alone database servers supporting business applications provided as a service by IMO.
Manage and support on-premise and cloud-based databases serving as the back end to hosted web applications.
At cFocus Software, we take good care of our employees!! We offer a generous benefits package including:
3 weeks of paid leave
401(k) with 4% employer match
Medical/Dental/Vision insurance coverage
Life/Long Term/Short Term Disability Insurance
Annual training
Spot bonuses, generous Xmas party gifts

Title: CMMS Database Administrator
Qualifications: Must be able to obtain and maintain Top Secret level security clearance.
FullDescriptions:
Visit our website at www.beringstraits.com to apply!
NOTE: Actual employment is contingent upon award of contract.

SUMMARY
Bering Straits Information Technology, LLC, a subsidiary of Bering Straits Native Corporation is currently seeking a qualified CMMS Database Administrator in Washington, DC. This position Administers Maximo application databases in Oracle 12G; optimizing application performance through database tuning and indexing, and develop maintenance scripts for record insertion, deletion, and cleanup as required and develop stored procedures as required.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
The Essential Duties and Responsibilities are intended to present a descriptive list of the range of duties performed for this position, and are not intended to reflect all duties performed within the job.
Implement Maximo 7.X as CMMS solution
QUALIFICATIONS - EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION
Required (Minimum) Qualifications
Must be able to obtain and maintain Top Secret level security clearance.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Other Characteristics
Database Systems; Oracle
Preferred
Six (6) to nine (9) years plus of directly related experience.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Must maintain a constant state of mental alertness at all times. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Essential and marginal functions may require maintaining physical condition necessary for bending, stooping, sitting, walking or standing for prolonged periods of time; most of time is spent sitting in a comfortable position with frequent opportunity to move about. Occasionally lift and or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. Must successfully complete a pre-employment physical agility test (PAT) and annually thereafter as prescribed by the government.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
Work Environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be borne by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Job is performed in an office setting with exposure to computer screens and requires extensive use of a computer, keyboard, mouse and multi-line telephone system. The work described herein is primarily a modern office setting. Occasional travel may be required. During visits to areas of operations, may be exposed to extreme cold or hot weather conditions. Occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, and loud noise.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
Supervisory duties do not apply to this position.

ADDITIONAL QUALIFYING FACTORS
As a condition of employment, may be required to pass a pre-employment drug screening, as well as have acceptable reference and background check results to obtain access to military base. Must have reliable transportation to/from work a necessity and must be able to obtain access to military installations.

Shareholder Preference. BSNC gives hiring, promotion, training and retention preference to BSNC shareholders, BSNC shareholder descendants and BSNC shareholder spouses, in that order.

Bering Straits Native Corporation is an Equal Opportunity/ AA/ Male/ Female/ Disability/ Vets employer.

We participate in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program. We are a drug free workplace.
